intro: Hyrtanandra pentandra, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and woodlands. The plant has traditional medicinal uses and is also valued for its hard, durable wood.
